title: Dutra's 87th Minute Goal Not Enough for UC Davis in 2-1 Loss
text:
Dutraâ€™s 87th Minute Goal Not Enough for UC Davis in 2-1 Loss
UC Davis men's soccer fell to UC Irvine 2-1 despite Andrew Dutra's late goal. The Aggies had a strong offensive showing with 12 shots compared to UC Irvine's 8, but could not equalize after Dutra scored in the final minutes. This marked the ninth one-goal loss for UC Davis this season, continuing their struggle on the road.
By the Numbers- UC Davis outshot UC Irvine 12-8, with a 6-4 advantage in shots per half.
- This was UC Davis' ninth one-goal decision of the season, struggling with a record of 2-8-5.
Despite outshooting their opponent and applying consistent pressure, UC Davis couldn't convert enough chances to secure points. Their difficulty in closing matches has resulted in substantial one-goal losses this season.
State of Play- UC Davis scored their first goal of the season in the 87th minute through Andrew Dutra.
- The Aggies had numerous scoring opportunities and earned six corners but were hindered by UC Irvine's defense and key saves from their goalkeeper.
UC Davis will look to rebound as they face Cal State Fullerton on Saturday, hoping to turn their fortunes around as they seek their first win in several matches.
Bottom LineUC Davis showcased offensive potential but continues to face challenges in finishing games, underlining the importance of converting chances as they move forward in the season.
